title: The Young Professional Satellite - From Theory to Reality (episode 2)
summary: In the second episode of this docu series, we take a closer look into what it took to build ESA’s Young Professional Satellite (YPSat). YPSat’s mission objectives are to capture the key moments of Ariane 6’s inaugural flight and take in-orbit pictures of Earth and space. To achieve this, the satellite requires the multiple sub-systems to work in harmony and adhere to a pre-defined mission sequence.

title: Orbital Defense Company Dark Completes Hot Fire Test Campaign
summary: Paris-based orbital defense company Dark has completed an initial hot fire test campaign for the combustion chamber of its Sheitan rocket engine. The engine will power the company’s air-launched Interceptor rocket. Founded in 2021, Dark initially planned to develop a multipurpose air-launched rocket. However, the company has since refashioned itself to focus on offering services […]

title: Juice's lunar-Earth flyby link to blog
Highlights from ESA’s first open day in the UK
summary: On Saturday 29 June, thousands of visitors made their way to ESA’s European Centre for Space Applications and Telecommunications (ECSAT), as part of the very first ESA open day to be held in the UK.

title: Military-to-civilian space traffic transition nears critical juncture
summary: The Office of Space Commerce is about to test its Traffic Coordination System for Space (TraCSS) after six years.

title: Europe set for crucial first launch of Ariane 6
summary: Europe is on the brink of a crucial moment as the Ariane 6 launch vehicle prepares for its inaugural flight Tuesday.

title: Could Avio’s Finalized Split from Arianespace Offer an Opening for Competitors?
summary: European Space Agency member states have agreed on the details of how customers already booked to be launched aboard Vega C flights will be managed after Avio splits from Arianespace. On 6 November 2023, during the ESA Council meeting in Seville, the agency’s member states adopted a resolution that would enable Italian rocker builder Avio […]

title: Space Team Europe for Ariane 6: Alexis Van Lysebeth
summary: They say it takes a village to raise a child. To launch a rocket, we have the combined expertise and passion of Space Team Europe. Alexis Van Lysebeth is one of many making the first Ariane 6 launch possible and has been interviewed as part of a series highlighting some of the people that make up this dream team.

title: What’s Happening in Space Policy July 7-13, 2024
summary: Here is SpacePolicyOnline.com’s list of space policy events for the week of July 7-13, 2024 and any insight we can offer about them. The House and Senate are in session […]

title: European Space Agency makes final preparations for inaugural Ariane 6 launch
summary: The first flight of the rocket will carry several payloads unto low Earth orbit for a variety of customers, including NASA. Teams are targeting launch from French Guiana on July 9, 2024, during a window that runs from 3-7 p.m. GFT (2-6 p.m. EDT, 1900-2300 UTC).
